intro: Pisonia palicureoides, commonly known as the white-flowered pisonia, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of the Americas, particularly found in countries like Mexico and Central America. The plant is characterized by its showy, white, clustered flowers that bloom in spring and summer. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly velvety texture. Pisonia palicureoides is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in warm, humid climates.
